enWisdom: Considering evil to be loathsome impels one to refrain from it

Wisdom: امْحُ الشَّرَّ مِنْ قَلْبِكَ تَتَزَكَّ نَفْسُكَ وَيُتَقَبَّلْ عَمَلُكَ
enWisdom: Efface evil from your heart, [and as a result] your soul will be purified and your actions will be accepted

Wisdom: الشَّرُّ أَقْبَحُ الْأَبْوَابِ وَفَاعِلُهُ شَرُّ الْأَصْحَابِ
enWisdom: Evil is the ugliest of gates and its doer is the worst of companions

Wisdom: احْصُدِ الشَّرَّ مِنْ صَدْرِ غَيْرِكَ بِقَلْعِهِ مِنْ صَدْرِكَ
enWisdom: Scythe the evil from the breasts of others be uprooting it from your [own] breast

Wisdom: اجْتَنِبُوا الشَّرَّ فَإِنَّ شَرّاً مِنَ الشَّرِّ فَاعِلُهُ
enWisdom: Keep away from evil, for verily more evil than the evil [itself] is its doer
When you see evil then distance yourselves from it
The one who gains victory by evil is [in actual fact] defeated
He who embarks on evil is successful in attaining it
Every victor who gains victory by evil is [in actual fact] defeated

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَعْرِفْ مَضَرَّةَ الشَّرِّ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ عَلَى الِامْتِنَاعِ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: One who does not know the harmfulness of evil is not capable of desisting from it
